item.title: 俄罗斯石油流量走低，莫斯科准备进行制裁测试
item.description:
出货量连续第二周下降，但仍高于年初至今的平均水平

。【原文：

Shipments dropped for a second week, but remain above year-to-date average

】

item.title: 新加坡监管机构终止对星展银行为期六个月的数字银行处罚
item.description: 新加坡最大的贷款机构星展集团控股有限公司（DBS Group Holdings Ltd.）改进了其数字银行服务中的一系列缺陷，新加坡金融监管机构将结束为期六个月的禁令，该禁令限制星展集团控股有限公司从事非必要的活动。【原文：Singapore’s financial regulator is ending a six-month ban that restricted DBS Group Holdings Ltd. from non-essential activities, after the country’s largest lender improved weaknesses related to a series of glitches in its digital banking services.】

item.title: UnitedHealth 股票销售促使立法者要求美国证券交易委员会进行调查
item.description: 以马萨诸塞州参议员伊丽莎白-沃伦（Elizabeth Warren）为首的美国民主党议员要求美国证券交易委员会调查联合健康集团（UnitedHealth Group Inc.【原文：Democratic US lawmakers led by Massachusetts Senator Elizabeth Warren are asking the Securities and Exchange Commission to investigate the timing of stock sales by UnitedHealth Group Inc.’s chairman and three executives.】

item.title: 调查显示，英美资源集团收购价需超过每股 30 英镑
item.description: 据彭博社调查的分析师和交易商称，对英美资源集团（Anglo American Plc）的收购价格需要超过每股30英镑（37.6美元），这一价格高于必和必拓集团（BHP Group Ltd.）上周的报价。【原文：A takeover of Anglo American Plc would need to be pitched at more than £30 ($37.6) per share, a higher price than BHP Group Ltd. offered last week, according to analysts and traders surveyed by Bloomberg.】

item.title: 美丽王朝从普伊格 IPO 赌注中获得 120 亿美元财富
item.description: 第一次世界大战期间，安东尼奥-普伊格的第一笔生意因德国潜艇击沉了一艘载有他未投保货物的船只而毁于一旦。不过，他的第二次创业却创造了世界上最大的财富之一。【原文：Antonio Puig’s first business ended in ruin during World War I when a German submarine sank a ship carrying his uninsured cargo. His second act, though, has led to one of the world’s largest fortunes.】

item.title: 英国五年期债券拍卖会需求创历史新高
item.description: 英国五年期债券的销售获得了创纪录的超额认购，缓解了人们对今年债券发行过剩可能难以找到需求的担忧。【原文：A sale of UK five-year debt was oversubscribed by a record amount, assuaging concerns that a glut of bond issuance this year may struggle to find demand.】

item.title: 可可两天内暴跌 26%，缩减历史性涨幅
item.description: 可可在伦敦和纽约市场的跌幅扩大，在过去两天里下跌了 26%，而此前的涨势曾创下历史新高。【原文：Cocoa extended a slump in London and New York, dropping 26% over the past two days, following a record-breaking rally.】

item.title: 中国国企将在经济低迷时出售 20 座上海办公楼
item.description: 据熟悉情况的人士称，上海一家大型国有房东提出以至少 300 亿元人民币（41 亿美元）的价格出售其大部分办公楼，这凸显了上海商业地产衰退的严重性。【原文：A major state-owned landlord in Shanghai is offering to sell most of its office buildings for at least 30 billion yuan ($4.1 billion), people familiar said, underscoring the severity of the city’s commercial property downturn.】

item.title: 据说富勒顿健康股权出售将使公司估值接近 10 亿美元
item.description: 新加坡富登健康公司（Fullerton Health Corp）已同意向远东药品公司（Far East Drug Co.【原文：Singapore’s Fullerton Health Corp. has agreed to sell a majority stake to Far East Drug Co. in a deal that people familiar with the matter said values the company at close to $1 billion.】

item.title: 红鸟国际传媒集团（RedBird IMI）在英国引起反响后启动《每日电讯报》出售计划
item.description: 在经历了几个月的挫折后，阿联酋支持的投资者红鸟国际投资公司（RedBird IMI）撤回了收购《每日电讯报》和《旁观者》杂志的尝试，并将寻求出售其对这些英国媒体的版权。【原文：After a bruising few months, UAE-backed investor RedBird IMI is withdrawing from its attempt to acquire the Telegraph newspaper and Spectator magazine, and will look to sell on its rights to the British outlets.】

item.title: 挪威将通过贝斯特拉（Bestla）连接线在北海再添一个油田
item.description: 挪威将在北海增加一个新的石油和天然气开发项目，延长附近一个已运营三十多年的油田的寿命。【原文：Norway will add a new oil and natural gas development in the North Sea, extending the life of a nearby field that has been in operation for over three decades.】

item.title: 巴克莱称国债收益率将因供应激增而持续走高
item.description: 巴克莱银行（Barclays Plc）认为，国债发行量过剩将超过美联储的任何政策支点，使长期收益率持续走高，并对全球债券造成压力。【原文：A glut of Treasury issuance will outweigh any Federal Reserve policy pivot to keep long-term yields elevated and pressure global bonds, according to Barclays Plc.】

item.title: 大众汽车、斯泰兰蒂斯在今年开局不利后押宝新车型
item.description: 今年，购车者将有更多选择。【原文：Car buyers should be spoiled for choice this year.】

item.title: 俄罗斯 Sovcomflot 公司正在为受美国制裁影响的油轮重新命名
item.description: 在美国实施制裁后，俄罗斯国有油轮公司将其部分船只以该国城市的名称重新命名。【原文：Russia’s state-owned oil tanker company renamed some of its ships after cities in the country following sanctions by the US.】

item.title: 高盛认为动量交易者在各种情况下都会买入股票
item.description: 根据高盛集团（Goldman Sachs Group Inc.【原文：Momentum traders are modeled to buy equities over the next week regardless of market direction, according to Goldman Sachs Group Inc.’s trading desk.】

item.title: 监督机构称瑞银在 CS 收购案中赢得了两位数的市场份额
item.description: 瑞士竞争监管机构称，瑞银集团收购瑞士信贷后，其在瑞士某些市场的份额增长了两位数。【原文：UBS Group AG’s shares in certain markets in Switzerland increased by double digits through the takeover of Credit Suisse, the country’s competition regulator said.】

item.title: 中国最高领导人暗示支持房地产和降低利率
item.description: 中国执政党中国共产党誓言要研究消化全国住房库存的措施，此举可以缓解房地产危机，并暗示愿意降低利率。【原文：China’s ruling Communist Party vowed to study measures to digest the nation’s housing stockpile, in a move that could alleviate the property crisis, and hinted at a willingness to cut rates.】

item.title: 中国将于七月推迟召开以改革为主题的党代会
item.description: 习近平主席将于 7 月召集执政党举行闭门会议，会议将密切关注世界第二大经济体的长期改革迹象。【原文：President Xi Jinping will convene his ruling party in July for a closed-door conclave that will be closely watched for signs of long-term reforms to the world’s second-largest economy.】

item.title: SES 同意以 31 亿美元收购 Intelsat 卫星交易
item.description: SES SA 已同意以 31 亿美元现金收购 Intelsat SA，以打造一个卫星巨头。【原文：SES SA has agreed to buy Intelsat SA for $3.1 billion in cash to create a satellite giant after reviving talks that fell apart last year.】

item.title: 高盛称基金可能抛售日本股票买入香港股市
item.description: 高盛集团（Goldman Sachs Group Inc.【原文：Global money managers may be starting to unwind their hugely popular long Japan, short Hong Kong equity trades due to the widening gap between valuations in the two markets, Goldman Sachs Group Inc. says.】

item.title: 匈牙利经济在逐步复苏中增长低于预期
item.description: 匈牙利第一季度的经济增长低于预期，证实了经济从衰退中缓慢复苏，这对严峻的预算前景造成了压力。【原文：Hungary’s economy grew less than forecast in the first quarter, confirming a slow recovery from a recession that’s weighing on a dire budget outlook.】

item.title: 英国-摩洛哥可再生能源连接计划获 1020 万美元资助
item.description: GE Vernova 公司向 Xlinks First 有限公司投资了 1020 万美元，该公司是一家英国公司，计划在摩洛哥建设一个大型可再生能源发电项目，并铺设一条 4000 公里（2500 英里）长的海底电缆，将能源输送到英国。【原文：GE Vernova Inc. invested $10.2 million in Xlinks First Ltd., the UK company planning a massive renewable power project in Morocco and a 4,000-kilometer (2,500 miles) undersea cable to deliver the energy to Britain.】

item.title: Glencore 预计今年贸易利润将再创佳绩
item.description: Glencore Plc 预计今年的贸易利润将再获丰收，目前有望达到其指导范围的上限，因为这家贸易商兼矿业公司将在强劲的大宗商品价格和高利率中获利。【原文：Glencore Plc expects another bumper year of trading profits and is currently on track to hit the top of its guidance range as the trader-cum-miner cashes in on strong commodity prices and high interest rates.】

item.title: 第一季度亏损扩大，法航荷航寻求削减成本
item.description: 法航-荷航（Air France-KLM）因支出增加、中东冲突和货运单位收入下降导致第一季度运营亏损扩大，作为削减成本举措的一部分，该公司将冻结辅助人员的招聘。【原文：Air France-KLM will freeze the hiring for support staff as part of a cost-cutting drive after reporting a wider first-quarter operating loss amid higher expenses, the conflict in the Middle East and lower cargo unit revenue.】

item.title: StanChart 表示，不要轻易将南非经济排除在外
item.description: 渣打银行（Standard Chartered Bank）的研究主管说，投资者不应该忽视南非而忽视非洲大陆的其他同行，因为南非拥有强大的机构，如果它专注于加速增长，就能支撑其经济。【原文：Investors shouldn’t dismiss South Africa over its other continental peers as it has strong institutions that can buttress its economy if it focuses on accelerating growth, the head of research at Standard Chartered Bank said.】

item.title: 富时 100 指数直播：英国市场现在的动向
日本央行数据或有助于显示日本是否干预外汇市场
item.description: 日本央行将于今晚公布数据，这些数据可能有助于解开周一日元兑美元汇率暴跌超过 160 点后，日本当局是否干预汇市之谜。【原文：The Bank of Japan is set to release data tonight that may help solve the mystery of whether authorities intervened in the currency market on Monday after the yen plunged beyond 160 per dollar.】

item.title: 法国经济增长有望走出衰退：欧洲国内生产总值最新数据
item.description: 法国第一季度经济增长加速，这增加了欧元区摆脱轻度衰退的可能性。【原文：French economic growth accelerated in the first quarter — boosting the chances that the euro area can emerge from a mild recession.】

item.title: 开始一天生活所需的五件事欧洲
item.description:
及时了解市场监测情况

Get up to speed with what the markets are monitoring

】

item.title: 梅赛德斯盈利因车型更迭和电动车下滑而下降
item.description: 受车型变化和电动汽车需求低迷的影响，梅赛德斯-奔驰集团第一季度盈利大幅下滑 34%。【原文：Mercedes-Benz Group AG’s earnings plummeted 34% in the first quarter, weighed down by model changes and sluggish demand for electric vehicles.】
